column3: Gábor didn't understand, so I explained it to them.

column2: Peti showed me her new car this morning.
column3: Peti showed me their new car this morning.

column2: Gréta disappeared and we couldn't find her for hours.
column3: Gréta disappeared and we couldn't find them for hours.

column2: András has not promised anything, but we expect her to help us.
column3: András has not promised anything, but we expect them to help us.

column2: Tom is dyeing her hair.
column3: Tom is dyeing their hair.

column2: Tom wanted to stay for dinner, but she had to go back to work.
column3: Tom wanted to stay for dinner, but they had to go back to work.

column2: Tom liked the music, although the lyrics were in a language she didn't understand.
column3: Tom liked the music, although the lyrics were in a language they didn't understand.

column2: The teacher waited for two hours for the guardian of the child in her class, but she did not show up.
column3: The teacher waited for two hours for the guardian of the child in their class, but they did not show up.

column2: The neighbour bent over her child and kissed her.
column3: The neighbour bent over their child and kissed them.

column2: The nurse considers her to be the best doctor she works with.
column3: The nurse considers them to be the best doctor they work with.

column2: She begged her to give her another chance.
column3: They begged them to give them another chance.

column2: She asked her where she had gone.
column3: They asked them where they had gone.

column2: She did not know her.
column3: They did not know them.

column2: She taught her her trade.
column3: They taught them their trade.

column2: She has no chance of convincing her.
column3: They have no chance of convincing them.
